summary: This is an email from an associate at Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, dated October 7, 2013, providing an update on beneficiary research. It mentions six beneficiaries, with one alert for an individual accused as a co-conspirator and three with no alerts, while two research reports are pending. The document is marked as confidential pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e).

persons.name: Paul Morri
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding beneficiary research updates from a Deutsche Bank associate.

events.title: Beneficiary Research Update
events.description: An associate at Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas sends an email to Paul Morri providing an update on research into six beneficiaries, noting one alert for an individual accused as a co-conspirator and three with no alerts, with two reports still pending.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 7, 2013, concerning research on six beneficiaries.
One beneficiary triggered an alert because they were accused as a co-conspirator.
Three beneficiaries had no alerts, and research reports for two beneficiaries were still pending.
The correspondence is marked as confidential under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), which governs grand jury secrecy.
The email originated from an associate at Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, indicating financial institution involvement in monitoring beneficiaries.
